titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to James F. Tureman
CWG13766

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1864 Clothing, Camp & Garrison Equipage, Telegraph Expenses, Some Claim Letters; Bundle 1

body.p:
NO. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To James F Tureman, Dr.

row.cell: For Expenses ^services rendered^ in organizing Enrolled Militia of the state for Month of March

body.p: Approved, and the Q. M. Genl is ordered to pay it out of Militia fund
I certify that the above account is correct and just, and that the services were rendered as stated, and were necessary for the public service.

D. W. Lindsey
Inps Genl Quarter Master.

Received at Frankfort Ky the 2d of April 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter=Master General for the State of Kentucky, Eighty Three dollars and thirty three cents, in full of the above account.
(DUPLICATE.)

NO. 22.
The State of Kentucky,
To James F Tureman, Dr.

row.cell: For Expenses ^services rendered,^ in organizing Enrolled Militia of the State, for Month of March

body.p: Approved, and the Q. M. Genl is ordered to pay it out of the Militia fund.
I certify that the above account is correct and just, and that the services were rendered as stated, and were necessary for the public service.

D. W. Lindsey
Insp Genl Quarter Master.

Received at Frankfort Ky the 2 of April, 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter=Master General for the State of Kentucky Eighty three dollars and Thirty three cents, in full of the above account.
(DUPLICATE.)

No. 22.
No Abstract.
Jas F. Tureman
Dollars 8333/100
Paid April 2d 1864.
State Guard
(21
(Militia)
